alert.note: Alert for Coal; Garvin; Hughes; Johnston; Lincoln; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 1:57PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Johnston, northeastern Garvin, northwestern Coal, Seminole, southeastern Lincoln, Pontotoc, northeastern Murray, central Pottawatomie, western Hughes and southeastern McClain Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 157 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Little to near Bowlegs to 4 miles south of Konawa to near Vanoss. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shawnee, Ada, Seminole, Tecumseh, Holdenville, Wewoka, Prague, Stratford, Konawa, Wetumka, Byng, Maud, Allen, Roff, Earlsboro, Stonewall, Bowlegs, Asher, Wanette, and Tupelo. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 187 and 213. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coal; Garvin; Hughes; Johnston; Lincoln; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole
